metadata.title: CVE-2015-5623 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
WordPress before 4.2.3 does not properly verify the edit_posts capability,which allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended accessrestrictions and create drafts by leveraging the Subscriber role, asdemonstrated by a post-quickdraft-save action to wp-admin/post.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5623` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

wordpress - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-l10n - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfifteen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentyfourteen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
wordpress-theme-twentythirteen - 4.2.4+dfsg-1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: wordpress package in esm-apps/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.2.4+dfsg-1').
